plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are a diverse group of flowering plants known for their beautiful, fragrant blooms and a wide variety of colors. Many species and cultivars bloom repeatedly from late spring through summer into early fall.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early fall (May to September)
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, including North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: The ancient Romans used rose petals for their fragrance and medicinal properties, and the rose has been a symbol of love and beauty for centuries.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A flowering plant species known for its tall, dense spikes of pea-like flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in meadows and open forests and is a favorite in gardens for attracting pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to mid-summer (June to July)
plants.location: Native to western North America but cultivated extensively in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich the soil by fixing nitrogen thanks to bacteria in their root nodules, improving soil fertility naturally.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: An aquatic plant with large, showy flowers that emerge above the water surface. It is revered in many cultures for its spiritual significance and stunning beauty.
plants.location: Wetlands of Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens globally
plants.funFact: The lotus flower's leaves are highly water-repellent, a phenomenon known as the 'lotus effect', inspiring self-cleaning technologies.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A striking flowering tree with brilliant red, spiny flowers that attract hummingbirds and pollinators. It is often used as an ornamental tree in warm temperate and subtropical regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to summer (October to February in Southern Hemisphere)
plants.location: Native to South America (Argentina, Uruguay, Paraguay), cultivated in subtropical climates
plants.funFact: The Cockspur Coral Tree is the national flower of Argentina, symbolizing strength and resilience.
